title: UK interest rates remain at 0.5%
text:
UK interest rates remain at 0.5% 6 August 2015 Save 
China’s collapsing stock market and ongoing economic issues in Greece have helped keep UK interest rates at 0.5%. 
The Bank of England’s Monetary Policy Committee voted by eight to one this morning to keep the rate at a record low for the 78 th month. 
Although certain analysts had predicted two or three policymakers would have voted for an increase. However, while the overseas issues remain global growth looks muted so prompting the near-unanimous decision. 
“It would have been imprudent to push through a rate rise at this moment when our economic recovery remains in need of care and encouragement,” said John Longworth, director general of the British Chambers of Commerce. 
“Rates will eventually have to rise and when they do, it should be done slowly and steadily. Until that moment, the Bank of England is right to keep interest rates at current levels.”
